titleStmt.title: A. W. Ford et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8895

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: Whereas Esqr Wm Carter was by the verdict of the Jury at the present term of the Caldwell Circuit Court fined in the Sum of Five Hundred dollars for an alledged Usurpation of Office Now the undersigned Citizens of Caldwell County Ky, would Respectfully petition the Governor on the behalf of said Carter and for a remission of said fine, Esqr Carter is an old Citizen of our County with a large family and a poor man, a man of good moral character, a good citizen & we have never before known him to have ever been charged with a violation of any law whatever This 5th June 1863

A W Ford T. M. P
Bryant Nichols
W Rucker
David Nelson
B. J. Grubbs
R. L. Harper
A. Reynolds D Shiff
Jas,, B,, Sasseen
J. Y, Chambers
L. Pepper Atty at Law
J. R. Fearless
Wm M Robertson
W E. Mitchesson clk C C
J M Harper Shff C C
A C Mayes
J P, Roscoe
James H. Leech
N. C. Byrd
James Young
D. J. Bailey
Notwithstanding the charge was fully sustained as proof If consistent with Executive clemency, & in view of the other facts stated in Petition. I would respectfully request that said fine be remitted

E. P. Watkins Clk C.C.
E N B Ratliffe
Will. Carter Caldwell County pettn to remit fine
